element.definition: No description

element.label: NHI
element.short: The current (live) NHI number
element.definition: The National Health Identifier. This is the 'live' identifier. Any previous merged identifiers will be present in the 'dormant' NHI list.

element.label: dormantNHI
element.short: Dormant NHIs that have been linked to the Live
element.definition: Other identifiers that may be exchanged. In this implementation this will only be dormant (or merged) NHI's, and the 'use' element will have the value 'old'.
element.comment: When a query using identifier is made, the 'active' record will always be returned. (So  the Patient.identifier may not be the same as the identifier used in the query, but may be in the dormant list)

element.label: name
element.short: A name associated with the patient
element.definition: A name associated with the individual.
element.comment: A profile will be created that specifies the additions to this datatype: http://hl7.org.nz/StructureDefinition/NHIHumanName (Note: may change the datatype mapping for clarity)

element.label: source
element.short: Where the name was sourced from
element.definition: Where the name comes from - what 'type' of source (eg a Passport).
element.comment: This is not really a candidate for using the Provenance resource as it is more about the 'type' of source than a specific 'instance' of the source. eg it just states that the source was a passport - not a specific passport.

element.label: isPreferred
element.short: Marks the name that is preferred (If there is more than one)
element.definition: the opatients preferred name
element.comment:
note potential clash with use=usual

business rule that only 1 can be 'isPreferred'

element.label: telecom
element.short: Contact details for the individual
element.definition: A contact detail (e.g. a telephone number or an email address) by which the individual may be contacted.

element.label: gender
element.short: The 'administrative' gender for the patient
element.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the patient is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

element.label: responseText
element.short: Free text response - before being coded
element.definition: when 'other'; was specified in a form this is what they said

element.label: birthDate
element.short: The date of birth for the individual
element.definition: The date of birth for the individual. Will always be included in an NHI interaction.
element.comment: Will always be included in the NHI

element.label: source
element.short: The source of information for the birthdate
element.definition: The source of the date of birth - eg from a birth certificate or a passport

element.label: deathDate
element.short: Date of death (if the patient is deceased)
element.definition: The date the patient died (if they are deceased)

element.label: source
element.short: The source of the date of death
element.definition: The source of the information
element.comment: Who stated the patient was deceased

element.label: ethnicity
element.short: Ethnicity code. From the 'level 4' codeset
element.definition: The ethnicity of the patient. One to six level 4 codes.

element.label: address
element.short: Addresses for the individual
element.definition: Addresses for the individual.
element.comment: A profile will be created that specifies the additions to this datatype: http://hl7.org.nz/StructureDefinition/NHIAddress (Note: may change the datatype mapping for clarity)

element.label: buildingName
element.short: The name of the building
element.definition: No description

element.label: line
element.short: Line numbers for the address
element.definition: The individual address lines. There will be a maximum of 2.

element.label: suburb
element.short: The address suburb
element.definition: The suburb of the address. This is not the same as 'district' or 'state.
element.comment: either in a line or use suburb or use an extension

element.label: city
element.short: The address city
element.definition: No description

element.label: postalCode
element.short: The 4 digit postal code
element.definition: No description

element.label: country
element.short: The country
element.definition: No description

element.label: countryCode
element.short: The international country code
element.definition: No description

element.label: derivedData
element.short: Additional information that is derived from the address
element.definition: Additional address elements exposed by the NHI and calculated from the address using the eSAM address service

element.label: latitude
element.short: Address latitude (NZ Datum)
element.definition: The latitude of the address - derived from the eSAM service, which uses an NZ specific datum

element.label: longitude
element.short: Address longitude (NZ Datum)
element.definition: The longitude of the address - derived from the eSAM service, which uses an NZ specific datum

element.label: meshBlock
element.short: Address mesh block unit
element.definition: A meshblock is both a geographic unit and a classification. It is the smallest geographic unit for which statistical data is reported by Stats NZ. A meshblock is a defined geographic area, varying in size from part of a city block to large areas of rural land. Meshblocks are contiguous: each meshblock borders on another to form a network covering all of New Zealand, including coasts and inlets. The meshblock classification extends out to New Zealand’s 200 mile exclusive economic zone (EEZ).

element.label: deprivationDecile
element.short: Deprivation Decile - a measure of deprivation based on address
element.definition: Deprivation deciles are based on the Index of Multiple Deprivation 2015 (IMD15), which is the official measure of relative deprivation. Decile one represents the most deprived and decile 10 represents the least deprived

element.label: deprivationQuintile
element.short: Deprivation Quintile - a measure of deprivation based on address
element.definition: a small-area-based index providing a measure of neighbourhood deprivation

element.label: domicileCode
element.short: Domicile code used for national collections
element.definition: A code indicating area that this address corresponds to

element.label: validationId
element.short: Validation service ID. For advanced use only.
element.definition: Points to the id used buy the internal address coding. For use by advanced users only.

element.label: notValidatedReason
element.short: The reason the address was not validated
element.definition: The reason why the address has not been validated

element.label: isPrimary
element.short: Indicates that this is the patients primary address
element.definition: Indicates this is the primary residential address - each patient must have one and only one

element.label: generalPractitioner
element.short: Patient's nominated primary care provider
element.definition: Patient's nominated care provider.

element.label: usualGP
element.short: The identity (HPI CPN) of the usual GP
element.definition: The GP that the patient generally sees - will only have the identifier / display, but may become a reference to the HPI Practitioner
element.comment: Note that the reference is via the practitioner role - ie Patient -> PractitionerRole -> Practitioner. This is likely to be a contained resource, with the PractitionerRole reference being of type Identifier (to the HPI CPN) rather than an actual resource reference

element.label: usualClinic
element.short: The clinic (facility) that the patient usually attends
element.definition: The clinic that the patient generally attends for GP services. Will only have the identifier  (HPI Facility id) / display initially.
element.comment: Note that the reference is from the practitioner role - ie Patient -> PractitionerRole -> Location. This is likely to be a contained resource, with the PractitionerRole reference being of type Identifier (to the HPI facilityId) rather than an actual resource reference

element.label: enrolledGPPractice
element.short: The GP organization - ie the practice, not the individual
element.definition: The GP practice (expressed in FHIR as an Organization) that the patient is registered with. will only have the identifier / display
element.comment: Note that the reference is from the practitioner role - ie Patient -> PractitionerRole -> Organization. This is likely to be a contained resource, with the PractitionerRole reference being of type Identifier (to the HPI OrgId ) rather than an actual resource reference

element.label: birthCountry
element.short: Country of birth
element.definition: The country where the person was born
element.comment: Because of the need to capture source, this will need to be a complex extension (or 2 separate extensions which seems a bit inelegant)

element.label: country
element.short: The actual country code or name
element.definition: The birth country.
element.comment:
ISO 3166-1:2006 Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions – Part 1: Country Code 
HISO 10046 Country of birth code

element.label: placeofbirth
element.short: Where in the country the person was born (if known)
element.definition: The actual birth place - as a string

element.label: source
element.short: The source of information for the country of birth
element.definition: The source of information concerning the country of birth

element.label: nzcitizenship
element.short: Information about New Zealand citizenship
element.definition: New Zealand citizenship

element.label: status
element.short: The citizenship status
element.definition: No description

element.label: source
element.short: source of information about citizenship
element.definition: No description

element.label: DHB
element.short: The patient DHB (District Health Board)
element.definition: The District Health Board the patient resides in. It is derived from the patient's primary residential address. Not updated directly.
